title: Wonderful

title: Thanks
comment: Your app is exactly what I needed, great app, keep up the good work.  I have a question, can I set up a desktop shortcut of a online ssh command ? I'd like to be able to unmount a external drive from my router before I shut it down from its power button.
Works OS 2.1 Samsung Moment where connectbot  won't accept password, w multiling non-O  but not stock android or QWERTY kbd.  No ctrl^ <> .
Make it less complicated then I will rate 5

title: Aplikasi Keren!!!!
comment: Saya bisa remote komputer kantor dari hp dimana saja dan kapan saja. Terutama ketika user menginformasikan ketika server sedang error. Saya tinggal connect dan restart service yg error tsb. Thanks

title: Perfect.
comment: Combined with Linux Deploy and the Hacker's Keyboard, I can do everything!
It quits without notice sometimes when put in the background. Also, it doesn't recognize key sizes of imported SSH keys, though the keys still work.

title: Beautiful!!!
comment: Great work!!!!

title: Good job
comment: Took it as you are also FreeBSD dev as well! Keep up the good work :)

title: Works- fixes and improves on the original connectbot
comment: The original connectbot could not handle my bluetooth keyboard - it was impossible to type the symbols above the numbers.  Searching finds this is a long running problem with the program.  Unlike the original, this version also lets you use pinch gestures to resize the fonts (instead of the volume keys).  Much nicer.  This _open_source_ fork gets gets 5 stars.
Great app

title: Excellent-
comment: Many configuration options including font size, essential for old, tired eyes. Thanks, Dev.

title: has everything
comment: everything but scp -r folder

title: Awesome
comment: Better than ConnectBot. Beats the crap out of Juice.

title: Great but please add MOSH support!
comment: I switched from JuiceSSH as this supports SCP, but need MOSH support to switch for all uses.

title: Judgement:
comment: Terminal awesomeness. Thank you, Dev...

title: Fine for SSH, but not tunneling
comment: Worked well to generate keys and open a password-free SSH connection, but wouldn't open a tunnel.

title: The only Android SSH client that works with ncurses
comment: This fork of connectbot works well, and as far as I can tell is the only Android SSH client that emulates an xterm well enough that ncurses applications work in it.  This plus scp capability is a winning combination.  It shows great promise.  The only downside:  I can't quite figure out what governs when it will and won't let me upload and download files.  Adding a feature to automatically upload and install public keys would make it just about perfect.
A full featured SSH client with better input support than the original.
Recommended.

title: Key based logins
comment: This app works  perfectly with ssh key only logins. Thanks
The tops,  only wish it worked in landscape

title: Superb app.
comment: Absolutely must have!

title: Fantastic client.
comment: Really solid.  Odd SSH cert mechanics, which can be trying.  Plus i can customize each connexion, which is great when running multiple sessions.  Auto-reconnect would be marvellous.  Fix that and the SSH oddities and you've got 5 stars!

title: very good ssh client
comment: I'd like to have a "copy this profile" function though.

title: Nice, even supports CTRL on bluetooth keyboards!
comment: Came from Connectbot where CTRL on bluetooth keyboards did not work. Nice to see that things here work great!

title: Won't stay connected.
comment: Good, but despite having enabled 'persistent connections', it disconnects as soon as I try to switch to another app.

title: Really nice
comment: Best ssh client

title: Works well, does the job
comment: Seems to have comprehensive features and I was (eventually) able to to get it to work with my TF701t keyboard dock. The only thing which puzzles me is why on earth it seems to be consuming so much memory. I've got one connection active, and setting thinks it is using 26Mb!! That seems ... excessive, to say the least.

title: It is good for Lifetouch NOTE Series
comment: When I use a gunine ConnectBot, I can't use some special characters such "Ctrl," which are important for coding and using remote linux terminals on my tablet having hardware keyboard, but now VX enable me to do it perfectly!! Awesome!!

title: Does its job well
comment: It is nice, yes! Thank you! But I'd like to ask for a feature: implement autossh. Autossh basically auto-reconnects to hosts that lost connection. Just that simple. Configuring timeout could be really great. Thanks again!

title: Awesome
comment: Fantastic. No ads. Everything you need. Plain and blazing fast.

title: Log in to your own phone
comment: All you need is a shell. That's exactly what you get. I love binding the tab (Completion) and Esc (vi mode) keys to the volume buttons.
Great app!

title: Encoding works
comment: looking good
Exclusively app

title: Great but where's scp dir browsing?
comment: I remember vx allowing dir browsing local and remote for scp in background, where'd that go?

title: Connectbot for physical keyboard
comment: Was loving ConnectBot since it was released. However the keyboard mapping in the original ConnectBot didn't really work with a physical keyboard (and Swiss German layout), so I tried VX Connectbot. Here my physical keyboard works great, without having to change any settings.  Besides that there are some very nice new features which can come in handy, too!

title: Featureful and Dependable
comment: Thank you!

title: Very Pleased
comment: Just started using it but my initial impression is that I could not be pleased more.

title: Simple but works!
comment: Possibly lacks some features but this simple SSH client did it's job when I needed it. Don't use SSH very often on my mobile phone, so I'm not a heavy user with complex setups.

title: Great but small changes would rock
comment: I have a little point though. Those things are strange with original connectbot too.  First main settings menu "manage pub keys": those are private keys. The public keys are stored on the server.  Then settings for a ssh connection "use SSH auth agent": shouldn't it be forward ssh agent?

title: Great for external Bluetooth keyboard, but sometimes disconnects
comment: This works perfectly with an external Bluetooth keyboard, such as the Apple Bluetooth keyboard.  Only problem is that sometimes it won't keep connections open in the background (with a Nexus 7 2012 4.3)

title: Arrow keys support
comment: Is a good app but need solve in a better way the arrows key emulation, long press on screen is not a good way and the window appear in the middle of screen covering the command line.

title: What the heck!?
comment: Yes, it has more functions than original ConnectBot, but it randomly crashes, has anomalyes with "screen"(terminal multiplexer), and crashes when something very fastly scrolls... good thing that i have options button on my phone, otherwise i couldn't use force terminal size... please update it

title: Great and reliable
comment: I really enjoy this app.  A huge part is because is supports a physical keyboard, which really helps when using an android tablet.  As far as I can tell, it's very reliable.  Love it :)

title: Superb
comment: Superb

title: AuthenticationMethods not properly supported
comment: Not properly handling connections to SSHD where AuthenticationMethods is used. I.e.: If you have this: AuthenticationMethods publickey,password Once you try to authenticate with publickey it says failed and asks for a password. You are still able to log in after eneting the passwd, it just says that auth. failed, instead of 'partial authentication' or 'further authentication needed'. In a different scenario using AuthenticationMethods again, I couldn't log in at all. Once this is added it would go directly to 5 stars.

title: Good.
comment: It works nicely, and it doesn't require too many permissions.

title: Superb SSH app!
comment: Very configurable, supports lots of keyboards - my TF300T keyboard amongst others. Best client I've used for Android so far.

title: Samsung galaxy tab3
comment: For me it was the only ssh client, capable to import openssh keys correctly on samsung galaxy tab 3.

title: Ipv6 doesnt work.
comment: APP says address is incorrect. Putting address in square bracket doesn't help

title: Improvement of the original!
comment: I love to use a physical hardware keyboard when I use SSH. Connectbot couldn't do that, especially control keys. VX Connectbot does! I hightly recommend VXCB over regular CB.

title: Mantap !!!
comment: Ini lebih baik daripada yang sejenisnya, sukses, terus tingkatkan...

title: Works better than original
comment: Only ssh client I've found the supports the sym key and special symbols like pipes, tildes, etc.

title: Nice!
comment: I’m connectbot users, and I know this app would be much better!

title: Connectbot clone
comment: I already have ConnectBot. Why would I need this? Same tunnel stability issues, no noticeable improvements.

title: Works great, tip regarding agent forwarding
comment: Just a tip for anyone new to this app; if you plan to use agent forwarding to ssh to one server and then on to another, you need to unlock your ssh key via the manage keys function before connecting to the first server.  Forwarding does not work if you let it unlock your key as part of the connection process to the first server.

title: Problem with nano
comment: I would put this rating to help you notifying a problem: when i open a file with nano, the application crashes on Nexus 4
Nothing better.  Combine with 'Hackers Keyboard'...

title: A Great App
comment: Very useful to me and easy to use.  Just a couple of feature requests: being able to select multiple files in the file transfer dialogue and some kind of file transfer progress indicator, maybe across the top of the screen or something?

title: Better than the best!
comment: This app successfully extends the capabilities of the original ConnectBot while retaining all of the stability and power of its predecessor. As such, I recommend this over ConnectBot for the addition of features alone.

title: Best connectbot fork for hardware keyboard support
comment: I was looking to use emacs on my motorola lapdock, which requires something that interprets Ctrl and Meta right. This is the ticket. You have to tap then release Ctrl rather than chording it, but that works.  Meta is Esc once, or Ctrl twice. Respect.

title: Coming from an ex connectbot user
comment: This app though based on connect bot, blows it out of the water with all of the additonal features.
Nice app

title: Great App
comment: Best free app for file transfers I've found, but desperately needs to be able to transfer directories. Also, a public key upload helper would be lovely. All in all, great app.

title: good on my droid4
comment: thank you

title: Best one out there
comment: I have tested many Android ssh clients and this one beats them all handily. Rock-solid stable and with many improvements, I'm particularly pleased of late with its masterful customization for Bluetooth keyboards. Keep up the good work!

title: Way better than connectbot
comment: It would be even better if you can save an username and password.  Ill change the rating to 5 stars when you can

title: Very convenient
comment: Works with private ssh keys too. Ideal to connect to my server while on the move.
Needs tablet support.

title: Much better keyboard support than the original
comment: Due to developer response, reverting to my 4-star review. I really do love this app... it handles hard-keyboards much better than the original. (Previous review was angry about changing the min-version of Android to 3.0.)
Due to problem reports with ECDSA on some devices I am reverting the latest changes (means 2.x back on track). The new version will be available as beta only.

title: Works great.
comment: Can connect to openssh server with protocol 2 and only dsa key. Some other clients had problems with that setup.
Flawless

title: Best SSH app on the market
comment: Enough said!

title: Brilliant
comment: Meets all my needs.
Excellent!

title: Extemely powerful!
comment: This is my 2nd review. In the past I was not able to use SYM (Alt+SPACE in hw keyboard) keys because it caused force close. Now I have Cyanogenmod ROM and works perfectly. Motorola Milestone 2. Deserves 5 stars!

title: Awesome
comment: I love this app. It works beautifully, even with tmux.

title: Great
comment: Very handy app, works perfectly with my bluetooth keyboard.

title: Telnet with okay ssh
comment: Handy as a telnet client for those quick unsecured connections.  Ssh client has issues with screen updates and extensibility.
Great App

title: Better for Hardware Keyboards By Far..
comment: After trying various combinations of ConnectBot, ConnectBot Irssi, and Better Keyboard, I finally gave up and tried VX.  Finally, I have control keys, unsticky shift on my bluetooth keyboard, and what little I need from there I can get by hacking my keylayout.

title: Perfect
comment: Full external keyboard support as well, just great.

title: Works great with Motorola Bluetooth Keyboard
comment: I loved ConnectBot, but this is even better - while the settings are ergonomically a little different from Connectbot, they are no harder to find your way around, and all of the Connectbot love is here.  My Nexus 10 and Motorola Atrix 4G Bluetooth Keyboard and Mouse set works a charm with this app. Just selected the Full Hardware keyboard profile from the settings, and it just works great. Didn't have to fiddle with any special mappings. As a busy sysadmin, this is going to prove a tough combination to beat if you are away from base.  Well done! No annoying ads - Guys, if you ever think of adding adverts, please offer an add free commercial version.

title: Great Support for Bluetooth Keyboards.
comment: Brilliant! I can now use emacs with my Nexus 7 and bluetooth keyboard.

title: Better usb keyboard support
comment: Connectbot doesn't play nice with standard usb keyboards, but this does. Tab completion works, and the shift key allows me to type all the symbols on the number keys. Four stars because <ctrl+c> tried to paste instead of sending an interrupt signal.
Foodfdd

title: Irsii connectbot and connectbot had a child
comment: Unlike Irsii connectbot this app has scp capability included, which is awesome.  But I wish the GUI could handle multiple files at once rather than one at a time.  So [only] 4 stars.

title: Crashes when backgrounded on Nexus 10
comment: Even with the "persist connections" setting enabled.

title: Awsome SSH client
comment: This is nearly perfect! Works perfect with my Motorola Droid 3, only one minor glitch: it makes the keyboard repeat, and accented charecters is entered by holding a key until a menu comes up. Minor sine the Droid 3 has all other special charecters directly on the keyboard like |[]{}\<>, this really is the perfect SSH phone terminal with VX connectbot

title: Didn't think it could get better
comment: ConnectBot was awesome for SSH connecting on the go, but I picked up a Bluetooth keyboard and started to feel limited by the restrictions of the program. Did a little research and found VX ConnectBot...I'm at a loss for words other than flawless, and perfection. Takes a little settings tweaking to get it just right but believe me this is what it's all about.

title: Fantastic!
comment: Absolutely a must have for developers working on a tablet. Basically a more feature rich connectbot. If you use a full hardware keyboard you need this version of connectbot to have support for your extra keys!

title: An improved Connectbot
comment: This is based on the well-loved Connectbot, and has all its virtues, together with significant improvements. I'm particularly grateful that ALT-SYM launches a selection panel for the extended keyset, including favorites like '|' and '>', making it much easier to do real work with the limited physical keyboard on my G2.

title: Excellent
comment: Great work, works perfectly with my BT keyboard.  A must for anyone that manages servers.
Fantastic addition to connectbot

title: Works well but difficult to use
comment: Common actions like Tab and arrow keys aren't quick to access. No way to change font size causes lots of strain on my eyes. Haven't been able to successfully scp download a file, tried many variations and even moved/renamed files. I will stick with Juice for now.

title: Essential for system admins
comment: Fantastic App. One of the most useful on my phone and tablet. Works brilliantly! Thanks!

title: Works nice on S3

title: Well designed and very useful
comment: And has saved my bacon as a sysadmin many times.

title: The best

title: Works fine on my Asus Transformer TF300
comment: This version of connnectbot works fine with my tablet's keyboard. I strongly recommend this version for those with Asus Transformer pads + the keyboard dock.

title: Awesome
comment: Great variant of cb. Though gesture mapping for arrow keys would be great on devices like the gs3 which have no d-pad since hacker KB has wonky mapping sometimes

title: works like a charm with external keyboard support
comment: Thanks for the great work.. Appreciated..

title: Better Than Original
comment: Detects hosts behind VPN firewall when using it.  Extra keys when SYM is pressed useful.  Lets me use the '@' character on the host, whereas the original did not.  Variable font size a plus.

title: Great functionality
comment: Works great and scp works but maybe a ui to make it simpler. I know it's setup to reflect how scp works but a noob friendly UI would be great.

title: Actually works w/ SSH keys!
comment: I highly recommend this as an SSH telnet client. It's the only one other than Padersync that works for me w/ SSH keys.
Nicely done

title: SSH Good, SCP Needs Work
comment: SSH looks good but SCP file transfers is a bit of a kludge. The file transfer is very manual but it does seem to work. A graphical file browser (think AndFTP) would be very welcomed. I don't use the file transfers often enough to make AndFTP Pro worth buying so the manual process with VX ConnectBot will work for my needs. Highly recommend Hacker's Keyboard for use with VX ConnectBot.

title: Won't run in background on ICS
comment: Really good open source software, but it won't stay running in the background on ICS when using tunnels.

title: Good one ...
comment: ...if only I could do copy & paste, use previous commands & some other basic stuff.

title: Improved Bluetooth keyboard support
comment: With the recent addition of hardware keyboard support, VX now works well with the Apple Wireless Keyboard, with normal-enough Ctrl and Shift functioning, even. And the continued updates are much appreciated. Thanks!

title: Dmitorbins
comment: The best ssh-client! I use it with Hacker's Keyboard. Superb! Thanks!

title: Soft keyboards work better now too!
comment: With the 2012/11/23 update the terminal resizes properly to accommodate software keyboards too!  Thank you so much!

title: Great
comment: Works wonders. Hardware keyboard is fully supported for my device. Almost a full terminal experience!

title: It is a solid ssh client
comment: it works well with my Nexus 7 + bluetooth keyboard. i can use it to manage my servers and i dont need to carry my laptop around. the hardware keyboard ctrl key and page up page down keys work well although i still need to figure out how to issue the escape. i highly recommend this client if you have a hardware keyboard.

title: Simply the best

title: Fantastic
comment: I was looking for a way to ssh and use the tab and ctrl keys on my physical keyboard and this did it

title: Asus Nexus 7 w/Menotek 'rollable' BT keyboard
comment: Thanks, so SO Much.  Works *great* on Asus Nexus 7 with Menotek 'rollable' keyboard, too. ( I also have a Freedom Pro.) Makes this tablet a seriously nice all-around tool. In fact, will check website to see if I can donate. :D AWESOME, MADE MY DAY!  PERFECT EXAMPLE OF WHY FREE_AS_IN_FREEDOM SOFTWARE *WORKS*! (P.S. I sent 4 euro == $5.20 US)

title: Thank YOU!
comment: I just switched from a Nokia N900 to an Xperia Pro and was starting to worry because none of the other ssh clients I tried was any good.  You saved my ssh'ing! Works perfectly with the hardware keyboard, and the extra mappings are very helpful.  Kudos!

title: Awesome Application!!
comment: Was using ConnectBot but the lack of support for hardware tab and control keys made linux work a pain. VX is a little more polished looking and adds much need hardware key support. Thank you!!

title: Must-have for SSH public-key auth
comment: I wouldn't be able to remotely manage any of my servers over SSH from Android, if it weren't for VX ConnectBot's support for public key authentication. Brilliant. That it has proper hardware keyboard support and is open source is icing on the cake.

title: Makes SSH 100% more usable on my TF300-T
comment: Like plenty of other Transformer users, I use it as somewhere between a tablet and a netbook - and my biggest frustration was with my ability to use SSH to connect to remote servers and make quick fixes when necessary.  For a hardware keyboard Transformer, this is just so much better than stock ConnectBot.

title: A much needed update
comment: Got this on my nexus 7 after struggling with vanilla connectbot. In this version my bluetooth keyboard plays nice, although I do wish the ctrl key had an option for making it behave like it does on a PC. Overall though, awesome.  Note for Nexus 7 users, don't both trying to install the connectbot tablet dev versions, they're pretty borked on the Nexus.

title: Most fixes but still not complete for bluetooth
comment: If I could only disable the shift and control locks on a hardware keyboard (I use an external bluetooth keyboard so don't need locks) it'd be perfect....

title: Works very well
comment: Having used the original ConnectBot until I discovered it didn't work well with the Transformer Prime keyboard, thrilled to discover VX ConnectBot fills that gap very effectively.

title: All the things ConnectBot is missing
comment: Needed a SSH client which would work with the ASUS Transformer hardware keyboard - ConnectBot was terrible (TAB, Shift, etc keys didn't work), but VX ConnectBot was perfect.

title: Excellent

title: ConnectBot... with keyboard that works
comment: Connect bot was great, except... you can type an asterisk, dollar sign, etc.  Lame.  This variant fixes these problems.  Works great - thanks
No problems here

title: Awesome!
comment: This is one of the best apps of its type on Play at the moment, combine it with the hackers keyboard, or even better an external one and you can geek from anywhere! Love it!

title: ConnectBot Revived
comment: Thanks so much to the developers of this fork for making ConnectBot useable again. It's wonderful to have working nicely with the hardware keyboard on my Droid 4, and it can also apparently read from my SD card where the original app on this same phone was failing. I imported my private keys successfully, and everything is working like a charm.

title: Hassle free
comment: Does just what it's supposed to do. Works perfectly with hacker's keyboard, deserves 5 stars.  - Posted from Samsung Tab2

title: Couldn't get it to rotate into landscape mode
comment: Once the client had connected. Shame but I really just want a halfway decent SSH client that is landscape mode friendly

title: Finally
comment: Just started learning Linux and needed an SSH client to practice in breaks at Work via my Nexus 7.  Was using ConnectBot original, but it lacked support for Tab, Crtl commands and various other issues, including the fact that I was not able to add !@#$%^&*() characters.   Tried Hacker Keyboard as saw a lot of people using that with ConnectBot, but it didn't work in my case.  Saw a comment mentioning this very application and I am so glad I tried it out. Perfection. Thank you developers. :-)

title: Excellent app
comment: The file up/down-load is a nice touch.

This is one of the reasons I wanted a captivate glide. My only issues are: auto-reconnect fails if it dosn't work the very first time, and there's no reconnect button, have to close the connection and start over. Which at least is quick. Oh, and the sceen never wraps right until I twiddle the font controls for the irst time, which I think I saw an issue or on the repo site.

title: scp problem
comment: It seems that scp can only download one file each time?

title: Wonderful with a physical keyboard!
comment: This is how the original ConnectBot should have been. It has a beautiful modern interface, a complete feature set, and great options. But best of all, this is the first variant of ConnectBot that actually uses a physical keyboard correctly.  It doesn't map shift-number to function keys, which makes entering common symbols like !@#$, very natural. It also works with the tab key. These are features you don't realize you miss until they are gone.    How could this be made better? It should stop hijacking the ctrl-c as a substitute for copying onscreen content. It would be better to do it like Android does it in text dialogs with arrows, or just save the copy feature for the menu.   All in all, a great app!

title: Landscape
comment: This app needs landscape badly, makes it unusable on a tablet in a case.  Otherwise functionality is great

title: Thank you from a Droid 4
comment: While I was married to ConnectBot, I was a little disappointed that the physical keyboard's tab key did nothing.  Given that I'm working in a largely Linux environment this is an important key to have!  This app solves that problem!  Thank you so much.

title: Bloodlust80
comment: The best ssh client for the ASUS transformer prime TF300T. It works with the keyboard nicely

title: Tab completion
comment: Great tab completion with default ICS keyboard

title: best ssh client for android
comment: This is absolutely the best SSH client for android, especially if you have a "real" keyboard (Asus Transformer, for example). For the technically-minded it's released as open-source, so that's a bonus too.

title: works fine
comment: better than the original one, but I prefer to send ctrl-c directly to the terminal, not to act as shortcut of copy. The shortcut of copy could be set as the same as the gnome-terminal alternative, ctrl+shift+c.
This is great, the best putty replacement ive seen

title: Best ssh
comment: Fixed screen size bugs in original connectbot. Great app

title: Awesome
comment: I use this to administer servers I'm responsible for maintaining. Never fails. One request: Droid 4 users like myself have no 'trackball', so some of the extra features don't apply. Thank you for this sweet app! :)

title: thanks a lot
comment: thanks for improving good old connectbot

title: same as last comment...
comment: definately works better than the standard connectbot, but requiring to release a modifier key (alt, ctrl, etc.) before pressing the key is pretty counter intuitive. Also, tf201 has native support for pgup, pgdown, home, and end. Would be awesome if these were supported a bit better rather than requiring the alt (release) direction combo.

title: Great for GUI, not for CLI
comment: Does all one could hope for if used from GUI, but does not provide "ssh", "sftp", or "scp" executeables which can be run from command line or script.

title: Worthy replacement for less actively-maintained connectbot
comment: I wish there were an easy way to migrate from connectbot (keys,saved connections, etc.) but even having to re-enter it all by hand the switch was worthwhile.  I can't imagine why there are not more installs.

title: THANK YOU!
comment: THANK YOU THANK YOU THANK YOU. My TF201 THANKS YOU.  Works great, I only have *one* nitpick left, on the TF201 keyboard you have to physically let go of the CTRL button when trying a combo like "CTRL+D". You have to hit CTRL, let it go, then hit D. If you could add support for me to hold CTRL and hit D, and when I release D the ^D keypress is sent.  Thanks again!

title: Excellent additions to a great app
comment: Tried this on my Galaxy Nexus. Loved it. And i like the fact that this version has addons, which make ConnectBot great for mobile server administration!

title: Perfect

title: Fantastic!!

title: Brilliant!

title: awesome - just what I needed
comment: thank you for writing this.  Most useful app.

title: Like ConnectBot but better
comment: At last, a Tab key on my Galaxy S2, plus the file transfer ability is very handy.

title: Works great with physical keyboards
comment: Yay!  I can finally use CTRL, Tab, Esc, etc. like normal with my physical USB keyboard!  Thanks!
Great, better than standard connectbot, the tab finally works on my Acer A500 on ICS. Only complaint is it does not seem to work in landscape mode.	Well done!
Beats basic ConnectBot with great enhancements for recent physical keyboard sliders. A must for server admins.

title: Switched from plain vanilla ConnectBot
comment: Quite a nice fork of ConnectBot. UI is more polished with very well thought out details resulting in much greater usability, plus a simple but very handy scp feature.  The only thing missing for complete SSH bliss is a feature similar to OpenSSH's ProxyCommand

title: vxconnectbot + hackers keyboard for emacs
comment: Been looking for a usable way to connect to a remote server and use emacs. Finally found that vx connectbot + hacker's keyboard allows me to send tabs, and ctrl & alt commands.
Very good

title: Very useful
comment: Ssh is the only remote connection that I completely trust, and this implementation is really nice to have. The capability of multiple simultaneous connections is great. Thank you, Mr. Matuska!

title: Features/Bug
comment: You could add more options to long-click menu (ctrl+..., alt+..., arrows - or add as transparent overlay) Swipe to change channels like in irssi would help as well. Bug: connection to local handset disconnects if there are changes to inet connections.

title: Vastly improved version of ConnectBot
comment: Nice! This is vastly improved over ConnectBot. Works awesome on my Galaxy Tab 10.1 and also my HTC Evo 4G. Thank you!

title: Great with Droid 4
comment: I switched to this because it supports the Droid 4 keyboard "out of the box".

title: Wildcard expansion on scp
comment: Works really nice with my Xperia Mini Pro.  Scp seems to download only the first file it found when wildcard is supplied.

title: Awesome!
comment: Works perfectly on ASUS TF101 with stock ICS. Very happy :-)

title: Crashes
comment: Crashes like original Connectbot on Transformer Prime with ICS.  I really surprised that there's no stable ssh client for Android. Thats a shame.

title: Works on DROID 4
comment: Works properly with DROID 4 hardware keyboard, vanilla connectbot doesn't. Thank you!

title: Even better than the original
comment: Fantastic client

title: Perfect ssh app
comment: Finally a perfect ssh client for xperia mini pro. Five stars!!!

title: Nearly perfect
comment: Please fix ?/ issue with TF201 hardware keyboard in it will get 5 stars!

title: is a must for xperia pro
comment: Good: xperia pro hardware keyboard support ("language" key mapped to ctrl/esc, "blue" key mapped to alt).  Good: long press menu with "change font size" and fullscreen toggle. Bad: missing national (e.g. russian) hardware keyboard support (non-latin symbols are available only using virtual keyboard, the same problem exists in upstream ConnectBot)

title: What a convenience!
comment: I was looking for a no-frills scp for the quick and secure file transfer, but found something even better: this app exports private or public keys into files, which lets me add them to ".ssh/authorized_keys" or import them someplace else. Well thought out complement to connect-bot! Free, no ads, I'll send a tip nonetheless.

title: Great on xoom
comment: Can adjust on xoom

title: Ok
comment: Thank you brother! Im using xperia pro too
Great! Especially the sym pop-up.

title: Excellent work!!!!
comment: Note to developers: Please try to use it on a device without keyboard (like touch-screen only phones), to see what improvements are needed. If you do something about this, it will be a killer app!
Nice work
